senses.de: To spread something, like information or seeds, widely
senses.ex: They disseminate their ideas through various online platforms

Tips.title: Communication Spread
Tips.description: Use 'disseminate' when referring to spreading ideas or knowledge among many people.
Tips.example: Scientists often disseminate their findings at conferences.

Tips.title: Educational Context
Tips.description: 'Disseminate' fits naturally in academic and informational contexts, not casual conversations.
Tips.example: The study's results were disseminated in a leading medical journal.

Tips.title: Conscious Selection
Tips.description: Choose 'disseminate' to imply careful, intentional spreading rather than random scattering.
Tips.example: The government disseminated guidelines for healthy eating.

senses.de: In biology, the distribution of organisms and their parts, especially plant seeds or spores
senses.ex: The trees disseminate their seeds in the fall

Tips.title: Biological Spread
Tips.description: Specifically describes how plants and organisms spread their seeds or spores naturally.
Tips.example: Dandelions disseminate seeds with the help of the wind.

Tips.title: Reproduction Strategy
Tips.description: In biology, 'disseminate' refers to a strategy by which species expand their presence.
Tips.example: The fungus disseminates spores to colonize new areas.

Tips.title: Natural Process
Tips.description: It conveys the natural aspect of distribution without human intervention.
Tips.example: After ripening, the pod bursts to disseminate the seeds.

Circulate.wordDefinition:
Circulate usually describes movement or spreading within a smaller or more localized group or area. For example, you might circulate a memo among your colleagues at work, or a rumor might circulate among a group of friends at school.

So, while both words refer to the sharing or spreading of information, circulate tends to be used for more specific or localized situations, while disseminate suggests a broader or more far-reaching distribution.

Diffuse.wordDefinition:
Diffuse means to spread out or scatter in different directions, while disseminate means to spread information widely.

Diffuse can be applied to physical objects or substances, such as light or gas, that spread out evenly in all directions.

For example, a diffused light would be one that spreads out evenly in a room.

Diffuse refers to the physical spreading out of something, while disseminate refers to the spreading of information or ideas.

Distribute.wordDefinition:
Distribute means to divide or deliver something among different people. It implies the idea of dividing tangible goods, such as products or resources, equally among a group of people.

Disseminate is more applicable when talking about spreading information, while distribute is more applicable when talking about sharing tangible things like products.

Proliferate.wordDefinition:
Proliferate means to increase in number or spread rapidly. It is applicable in situations where something is multiplying or growing quickly, like when a disease spreads or when a plant starts to take over an area.

Disseminate means to spread information, while proliferate means to multiply or spread rapidly.

Propagate.wordDefinition:
Both disseminate and propagate refer to the act of spreading information, ideas or beliefs.

Propagate refers to spreading information or ideas with the intent of promoting or persuading others to believe in that information or idea.

It typically implies that the person doing the propagation has a certain agenda or motive behind it, such as promoting a religion, political ideology, or scientific theory.

In brief, disseminate is broader in its meaning and can refer to the spread of any kind of information, whereas propagate is more specific and implies a certain level of intention or persuasion behind the spreading of information.

Spread.wordDefinition:
Disseminate means to spread something like an idea or information among a group of people in an organized way, usually through a specific channel like a website, news outlet, or newsletter.

Spread simply means to transmit or distribute something more broadly, without necessarily having a specific plan or method for doing so.

Disseminate suggests a more intentional and strategic effort to share information with a specific group, while spread is a more general term for transmitting something to a wider audience.

quotes.Text: You have women that are political commentators that are talking about the elections, talking about the news of the day, and really helping shape how information is disseminated. I feel we're reaching a whole new audience, which is great to be able to bring in and encourage other young women to do this.
quotes.Title: American Critic
quotes.Name: Kimberly Guilfoyle

quotes.Text: Terrorists in ungoverned spaces - both physical and cyber - readily disseminate propaganda and training materials to attract easily influenced individuals around the world to their cause. They motivate these individuals to act at home or encourage them to travel.
quotes.Title: American Public Servant
quotes.Name: Christopher A. Wray

quotes.Text: Few would deny the importance of tackling online hatred or child abuse content. The internet, after all, has become a key weapon for those who disseminate and incite hatred and violence against minorities, and for those who pose a horrifying threat to children.
quotes.Title: British Journalist
quotes.Name: Owen Jones

quotes.Text: The private sector complains that some of the agencies set up to advise and assist them in protecting their networks, such as CESG, are good at gathering information, but reluctant to disseminate it. This culture of information hoarding has to be changed.
quotes.Name: Crispin Blunt

quotes.Text: Human freedom increasingly depends on who controls what we know and, therefore, how we understand our world. It depends on what information we are able to create and disseminate: what we can share, how we can share it, and with whom we can share it.
quotes.Title: American Journalist
quotes.Name: Rebecca MacKinnon

quotes.Text: Teaching needs an ecosystem that supports evidence-based practice. It will need better systems to disseminate the results of research more widely, but also a better understanding of research, so that teachers can be critical consumers of evidence.
quotes.Title: British Writer
quotes.Name: Ben Goldacre

quotes.Text: I have always liked the idea of going to print because a big part of what we are about is to disseminate knowledge throughout the world and not just to people who have broadband.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Jimmy Wales

quotes.Text: A lot of artists are much more concerned about how their work is used and how it's disseminated. That, to artists, is as important as the money, for some people.
quotes.Title: American Businesswoman
quotes.Name: Hilary Rosen

quotes.Text: Terrorists, in ungoverned spaces, disseminate poisonous propaganda and training materials to attract troubled souls around the world to their cause.
quotes.Title: American Public Servant
quotes.Name: James Comey

quotes.Text: The goal of education is the advancement of knowledge and the dissemination of truth.
quotes.Title: American President
quotes.Name: John F. Kennedy
